intro: Diplostephium tacorense, commonly known as the Mexican milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its milky sap, which is a common feature among plants in this family. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange and are clustered in inflorescences, attracting various pollinators. The plant has been used traditionally in some regions for its medicinal properties.
